III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4125 Personal possessions; money; clothing;
Section storage space.
Description (1) A licensee shall have a written policy that designates all of the
following: (c) The method for ensuring that each resident has
sufficient clean, properly fitting, seasonal clothing.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth at facility have minimal clothing and no socks. They either
walk around dirty or wash clothing daily.
Investigation On 10/05/2023 review of the incoming complaint was
completed. It was noted that the complainant was
anonymous.
On 10/05/2023 at interview was completed with the Vice
President of Residential services (VPR) at Wolverine Center.
He denied youth are without proper socks, clothing and bed
sheets at the facility. He further denied youth do not have clean
clothing at the facility. He did confirm youth are afforded the
opportunity to wash their clothing daily, if they desire. He
explained youth are advised to place their dirty clothing outside of
their door before bedtime at night and the midnight staff will wash
the clothing. VPR escorted me around the building for review of
the bathrooms and bedrooms. Bedrooms were observed to have
white sheets and a thicker blue blanket for the bed. Some beds
did not have the white sheet on the mattress, but it was located in
the room. VPR advised some youth either prefer to sleep with no
sheet or refuse to put the sheet onto the mattress.
On 10/05/2023 an in-person interview was held with Youth A
at Wolverine Center. Youth A was preparing for a discharge
from the facility. Youth A reported while at the facility he was
provided with proper clothing and socks. He denied his clothing
was dirty and reported he was aware he could put his clothing out
daily to be washed. Youth A pointed out he was wearing his
favorite joggers that he had washed daily so that he could wear
them. Youth A further reported he was provided with proper linen
for his bed while placed at the facility.
On 11/08/2023 an in-person interview was held with Youth B
at Wolverine Center. Youth B reported his laundry is completed
whenever he requests and reported staff will help with laundry.
He reported “everyone” gets blankets and sheets for their beds.
He stated he chooses not to use his sheets. Youth B was
observed to have on hospital socks. He reported he obtained
them from when he was in the hospital. He reported the agency
does not have any socks or they don’t know where they are.
On 11/08/2023 an in-person interview was held with Youth C
at Wolverine Center. Youth C reported he has clean clothes and
has sheets for his bed. He reported he asked for a blanket once
and was told no. He was unable to provide additional information
2

regarding his denial of the blanket. He denied being cold at the
facility. He denied he has socks. He reported he asked for socks
but doesn’t get them and he doesn’t know why. Youth C was
observed to be wearing socks.
On 11/08/2023 an in-person interview was held with Youth D
at Wolverine Center. Youth D reported he has clean clothes and
can wash his clothes if he wants to. He described the
temperature in the building as “perfect” and denied he was cold in
his bedroom or anywhere in the facility. He reported he has both
a sheet and blanket for his bed. Youth D reported that he does not
have any socks. He reported he has asked for socks and was told
that they don’t have any. Youth D was not observed to be
wearing socks.
On 11/08/2023 an in-person interview was held with
Supervisor 1 at Wolverine Center. She reported youth are
allowed to wash clothing whenever they like and are aware of the
process to place clothing in the hall at night that they would like
washed. She reported youth are provided with both a white sheet
and blue blanket for their beds. She reported some youth choose
not to utilize the sheet for their bed, but they are always provided.
Supervisor 1 reported youth are provided with socks often. She
escorted me to the storage area where clothing and shoes are
maintained for the youth. Shoes, pants, and other articles of
clothing were observed. No socks were observed in the area.
Supervisor 1 reported the agency distributed that last pair of socks
yesterday and are expecting a delivery from Amazon today.
On 11/08/2023 a telephone call was completed with
Supervisor 2. Supervisor 2 advised an order for socks had been
placed and were scheduled for delivery today. Supervisor 2
reported the current census is 7 and all youth had been
administered socks and could make use of the laundry to clean
them if necessary. Supervisor 2 also reported youth are provided
with a sheet and a blanket for use on their bed.
Tour Observation
On 11/08/2023 a walkthrough of the facility was completed by this
consultant. Both sheets and blankets were observed to be in the
bedrooms of the youth. Some of the youth had the sheets on their
bed and some did not. I was able to confirm in rooms without the
sheet on the bed, that a sheet was in the room and was just not
being utilized. I was also able to confirm socks in random rooms
of youth. Socks were specifically noted in the room of Youth D
who reported he did not have any socks. Socks were not
3

specifically observed in the rooms of Youth B and Youth C,
however both youths were observed to have socks on their feet
during the interview.
Documents Reviewed
Wolverine Human Services Intake and Personal Items Policy was
reviewed. It indicated that staff are advised of all new intakes and
provided with clothing and shoe sizes and an intake bag will be
filled with clothing by the morning of the arrival of new youth.
Analysis At the completion of the investigation, it was found that the agency
was in compliance with licensing rule 4125 (1) (c). It was
confirmed that the youth had been issued adequate clothing,
including socks. Youth were also observed to be in clean clothing
and were aware of procedures to have clothing laundered.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4417 Toilet and bathing facilities.
Section (1) Toilet and bathing facilities shall be provided as follows: (a)
Description Toilets that allow for individual privacy, unless inconsistent with a
toilet training program or security program.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There are no doors to the bathrooms and the bathrooms are only
on the first floor.
Investigation On 10/05/2023 review of the incoming complaint was
completed. It was noted that the complainant was
anonymous.
On 10/05/2023 at interview was completed with the Vice
President of Residential services (VPR) at Wolverine Center.
He was advised of the nature of allegations. He denied the
bathrooms in the facility were not operative, missing doors and
only maintained on the first floor. VPR escorted me around the
building for review of the bathrooms and bedrooms. All
bathrooms that were being utilized by youth were found to have
doors to allow for privacy.
On 10/05/2023 an in-person interview was held with Youth A
at Wolverine Center. Youth A was preparing for a discharge
from the facility. He denied not having privacy while using
restrooms at the facility.
On 11/08/2023 an in-person interview was completed with
Youth B, Youth C and Youth D at Wolverine Center. All three
4

youth denied having a lack of privacy when using the bathrooms
at the facility and was not aware of any bathroom utilized by youth
in the facility that was without a door.
On 11/08/2023 an in-person interview was completed with
Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 at Wolverine Center. Both staff
denied allegations regarding lack of privacy for youth due to
bathrooms not having a door.
Tour Observation
On 11/08/2023 a walk through of the building was completed.
Doors were observed to be on the bathroom area to allow for
privacy.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, it was found that the agency
was in compliance with licensing rule 4417 (1) (a). The bathrooms
were observed and found to be affixed with doors. Interviews with
staff and youth also confirmed no concerns with lack of doors in
the bathrooms or lack of privacy.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4407 Facility and premises maintenance.
Section (1) A facility and premises shall be maintained in a clean,
Description comfortable, and safe condition. The facility shall be located on
land that is properly drained.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The air conditioning was left on for 24 hours and the youth were
cold.
Investigation On 10/05/2023 review of the incoming complaint was
completed. It was noted that the complainant was
anonymous.
On 10/05/2023 at interview was completed with the Vice
President of Residential services (VPR) at Wolverine Center.
He was advised of the nature of allegations. He denied any
concerns with air conditioning that would result in discomfort of
youth. A walk through was completed on the third floor where an
older model AC unit is utilized. The AC unit was found to be
working and was blowing cooler air in the hallway. The bedrooms,
recreation room and other areas that could be occupied by youth,
were found to be of normal temperature. VPR advised that staff
are aware of the cooler temperature in the hallway and usually
bring a jacket if they will be seated in the hall for nighttime
5

monitoring. He further noted that staff had reported that the unit
was not powering off in intervals as it had in the past. VPR
reported that a maintenance request for service had been
requested.
On 10/05/2023 an in-person interview was held with Youth A
at Wolverine Center. Youth A was preparing for a discharge
from the facility. He denied being excessively cold in any parts of
the facility during his placement.
On 11/08/2023 an in-person interview was completed with
Youth B, Youth C and Youth D at Wolverine Center. All three
youth also denied being cold in the facility or having knowledge of
an AC unit not working properly that made the facility cold.
On 11/08/2023 an in-person interview was completed with
Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 at Wolverine Center. Both staff
denied allegations regarding youth being cold due to an AC unit
not working properly. Both staff advised that the temperature
fluctuates in the building due to the age of the building but denied
every being too hot or too cold.
Tour Observation
On 11/08/2023 a walk through of the building was completed.
Consultant went to third floor to re-check and no concerns were
noted with temperature and all areas were found to be
comfortable.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, it was found that the agency
was in compliance with licensing rule 4407 (1). Interviews with
staff and youth confirmed no concerns with air conditioners and
youth being cold as a result of the air condition not working
properly. The air conditioner was also found to be operative.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
